|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070911130719/http://www.world-time-zones.org/zones/chile-time.htm |archivedate=September 11, 2007 }} | utc_offset = -4 | timezone_DST = [[Time in Chile|CLST]]{{cite web |url=http://www.world-time-zones.org/zones/chile-summer-time.htm |accessdate=2010-08-10 |title=Chile Summer Time |publisher=WorldTimeZones.org |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070911130451/http://www.world-time-zones.org/zones/chile-summer-time.htm |archivedate=September 11, 2007 }} | utc_offset_DST = -3 | footnotes = | area_code = 56 + 32 | website = [http://www.muniquintero.cl/ Official website] {{in lang|es}} }} '''Quintero''' is a [[Chile]]an [[List of cities in Chile|city]] and [[Communes of Chile|commune]] in [[Valparaíso Province]], in the [[Valparaíso Region]], 30 kilometers north of Valparaíso. The commune spans an area of {{convert|147.5|sqkm|0|abbr=on}}. It was the first port in the country, created during the expedition of Don Diego de Almagro . ==History== The name of the city comes from Alonso Quintero, the [[Spanish people|Spanish]] navigator who discovered the bay in 1536 when he arrived on the ship ''Santiaguillo''. In the early years of XXI century, Quintero has become famous as a symbol of insufficient environmental policies. Since the beginnings of XX century when an industrialization politics started{{Cita web|url=https://pras.mma.gob.cl/desarrollo_historico_ventanas/|title=Historia ambiental de Quintero y Puchuncaví.|date=|access-date=November 13, 2019|website=PRAS Programa para la Recuperación Ambiental y Social|last=|first=|archive-url=|archive-date=|url-status=live|quote=El Programa para la Recuperación Ambiental y Social PRAS, es una estrategia de trabajo multisectorial, liderada por el Ministerio del Medio Ambiente de Chile.}}, in the zone were built a thermoelectric coal plant by [[Enel Distribución Chile|Chilectra]] (currently [[Enel Distribución Chile]]) and the copper smelter Fundición Ventanas by [[Codelco]] in the nearby town of the same [[Las Ventanas|name]]; arriving to this date (2019) to be a zone informally known as Industrial Park Quintero-[[Puchuncaví]], including oil industries, liquefied gas terminals, and chemical industries among others, which has caused the bay and surroundings to be considered a "[[sacrifice zone]]"{{Cita web|url=https://www.elciudadano.com/medio-ambiente/quintero-y-puchuncavi-la-zona-de-sacrificio-que-no-logra-respirar-tranquila/07/24/|title=Quintero y Puchuncaví, la zona de sacrificio que no logra respirar tranquila.|date=July 24, 2019|access-date=November 14, 2019|website=El Ciudadano|last=Labbé|first=Daniel|archive-url=|archive-date=|url-status=live|quote=Quintero y Puchuncaví son consideradas zonas de sacrificio. Industrias como ENDESA, COPEC, SHELL, EPOXA, ENAP, GNL, GASMAR, OXIQUIM, CODELCO, CEMENTOS BIO BIO, PUERTO VENTANAS y AES GENER se encuentran emplazados a pocos kilómetros entre Quintero, Ventanas y La Greda, además de las termoeléctricas Ventana I, Ventana II, Nueva Ventanas y Campiche.}}. Multiple protests about the gradual environmental destruction were unsuccessful, until a serious episode of mass poisoning in August of 2018{{Cita web|url=https://www.elmostrador.cl/cultura/2018/08/29/combinacion-fatal-mezclas-de-contaminantes-ausencia-de-normativas-y-lobby-empresarial/|title=Combinación fatal en Quintero: mezcla de contaminantes, ausencia de normativas y lobby empresarial.|date=August 29, 2018|access-date=November 14, 2019|website=El Mostrador|last=Fajardo|first=Marco|archive-url=|archive-date=|url-status=live|quote=La crisis ambiental en la zona es fruto de largos años de emisiones por encima de la norma internacional de poderosas empresas (públicas y privadas) en la bahía, que han hecho un intenso y exitoso lobby para seguir funcionando así, y la desidia del Estado, que ha sido incapaz de imponer una ley con estándares internacionales. Así de categórica es la opinión de la comunidad científica que pronostica, que de no actuar seria y drásticamente, las emergencias, cada vez más graves en la zona, serán pan de cada día.}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.efe.com/efe/english/business/quintero-the-chilean-town-sacrificed-to-pollution/50000265-3781394|title=Quintero, the Chilean town sacrificed to pollution.|last=Valdés Gómez|first=Alberto|date=October 15, 2018|website=EFE|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=November 16, 2019}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.dw.com/en/environmental-scandal-casts-a-cloud-in-chile/a-46324933|title=Environmental scandal casts a cloud in Chile.|last=|first=|date=November 16, 2018|website=Deutsche Welle|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=November 16, 2019}}put a spotlight on the city's situation and its surroundings in Quintero Bay causing investigations by the [[Senate of Chile]]{{Cita web|url=https://senado.cl/contaminacion-en-quintero-puchuncavi-exigen-a-codelco-gener-y-enap/senado/2019-08-20/210841.html|title=Contaminación en Quintero-Puchuncaví: exigen a Codelco, Gener y Enap someterse a estudios de impacto ambiental.|date=August 21, 2019|access-date=November 13, 2019|website=senado.cl|last=|first=|archive-url=|archive-date=|url-status=live|quote=Los senadores de la Comisión de Medio Ambiente y de la Región de Valparaíso, junto organizaciones civiles de Zona de Sacrificio Quintero-Puchuncaví exigieron a Codelco División Ventanas someterse de manera voluntaria a un Estudio de Impacto Ambiental y denunciaron amenazas de la empresa a los trabajadores que han alertado el incremento de “gases fugitivos”.}}. By October of 2019, the situation remains unresolved.{{Cita web|url=https://www.cnnchile.com/pais/quintero-estudiantes-problemas-salud-contaminacion_20191016/|title=Jóvenes de Quintero deben cerrar el año escolar por problemas de salud tras episodios de contaminación.|date=October 16, 2019|access-date=November 13, 2019|website=CNN Chile|last=|first=|archive-url=|archive-date=|url-status=live|quote=La contaminación en la zona ha obligado a los adolescentes a dejar de estudiar o cambiar de ciudad para ingresar en otros colegios. Además de presentar malestares físicos, las víctimas también se ven afectadas por la depresión.}} ==Demographics== According to the 2002 [[census]] of the [[National Statistics Institute (Chile)|National Statistics Institute]], Quintero had 21,174 inhabitants (10,390 men and 10,784 women). Of these, 18,719 (88.4%) lived in [[urban area]]s and 2,455 (11.6%) in [[rural area]]s. The population grew by 19% (3,378 persons) between the 1992 and 2002 censuses. The demonym for a man from Quintero is ''Quinterano'' and ''Quinterana'' for a woman. ==Administration== As a commune, Quintero is a third-level [[administrative division of Chile]] administered by a communal council, headed by an [[alcalde]] who is directly elected every four years. The 2008-2012 alcalde is José Varas Zuñiga. Within the [[electoral divisions of Chile]], Quintero is represented in the [[Chamber of Deputies of Chile|Chamber of Deputies]] by Mr. Eduardo Cerda ([[Christian Democratic Party|PDC]]) and Mrs. Andrea Molina ([[Independent Democratic Union|UDI]]) as part of the 10th electoral district, (together with [[La Ligua]], [[Petorca]], [[Cabildo, Chile|Cabildo]], [[Papudo]], [[Zapallar]], [[Puchuncaví]], [[Nogales, Chile|Nogales]], [[Calera, Chile|Calera]], [[La Cruz, Chile|La Cruz]], [[Quillota]] and [[Hijuelas]]). The commune is represented in the [[Senate of Chile|Senate]] by Ignacio Walker Prieto ([[Christian Democratic Party|PDC]]) and Lily Pérez San Martín ([[National Renewal (Chile)|RN]]) as part of the 5th senatorial constituency (Valparaíso-Cordillera). == Climate == According to the [[Köppen Climate Classification]] system, Quintero has a [[Mediterranean climate#Warm-summer Mediterranean climate|warm-summer mediterranean climate]], abbreviated "Csb" on climate maps.[http://www.weatherbase.com/weather/weather-summary.php3?s=34558&cityname=Quintero%2C+Valparaiso%2C+Chile&units= Climate Summary for Quintero, Chile]
{{Weather box |location = Quintero |single line = Yes |metric first = Yes |Jan high F = 72 |Feb high F = 72 |Mar high F = 70 |Apr high F = 67 |May high F = 63 |Jun high F = 60 |Jul high F = 60 |Aug high F =61 |Sep high F = 62 |Oct high F = 65 |Nov high F =69 |Dec high F = 71 |year high F = 66 |Jan low F = 56 |Feb low F = 56 |Mar low F = 54 |Apr low F = 52 |May low F = 50 |Jun low F = 48 |Jul low F = 47 |Aug low F = 47 |Sep low F = 48 |Oct low F = 50 |Nov low F = 52 |Dec low F = 54 |year low F = 51 |Jan precipitation inch = 0.1 |Feb precipitation inch =0.1 |Mar precipitation inch = 0.3 |Apr precipitation inch = 0.6 |May precipitation inch = 4.1 |Jun precipitation inch = 5.9 |Jul precipitation inch = 3.9 |Aug precipitation inch = 2.9 |Sep precipitation inch = 1.3 |Oct precipitation inch = 0.4 |Nov precipitation inch = 0.2 |Dec precipitation inch = 0.2 |year precipitation inch = 19.9 |source 1 = Weatherbase {{cite web |url =http://www.weatherbase.com/weather/weather.php3?s=34558&refer=wikipedia |title =Weatherbase: Historical Weather for Quintero, Chile |publisher=Weatherbase |year=2011 }} Retrieved on November 24, 2011. |date=November 2011 }}
